title: 212th Division (Imperial Japanese Army)
text:
The was an <a href="infantry">infantry</a> <a href="Division%20%28military%20unit%29">division</a> of the <a href="Imperial%20Japanese%20Army">Imperial Japanese Army</a>. Its <a href="call%20sign">call sign</a> was the , after <a href="Kikuchi%2C%20Kumamoto">Kikuchi, Kumamoto</a>. It was formed on 2 April 1945 in <a href="Kurume%2C%20Fukuoka">Kurume</a> as a <a href="triangular%20division">triangular division</a>. It was one of a batch of eight divisions composed of the <a href="201st%20Division%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">201st</a>, <a href="202nd%20Division%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">202nd</a>, <a href="205th%20Division%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">205th</a>, <a href="206th%20Division%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">206th</a>, <a href="209th%20Division%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">209th</a>, 212th, <a href="214th%20Division%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">214th</a> and <a href="216th%20Division%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">216th</a> Divisions created as part of the reaction to the <a href="Battle%20of%20Okinawa">Battle of Okinawa</a>.
History.
On 11 June 1945, the "212th Division" organization and deployment was complete. The 516th and 518th Infantry Regiments, together with service units, were in <a href="Tsuno%2C%20Miyazaki">Tsuno, Miyazaki</a>, while the 517th infantry regiment was in <a href="Kurume%2C%20Fukuoka">Kurume</a> It did not see any combat by the time of the <a href="surrender%20of%20Japan">surrender of Japan</a> on 15 August 1945.
